Phase 3 (2024-2027):

Scaling Up

The overarching goal of Phase 3 is in a method for the model’s wide national-level adoption seeking by public libraries in various community contexts, named, a scaling up process. Because many projects “that appear highly successful on a pilot scale prove impossible to expand or replicate on a larger scale” (Anandajayasekeram, p. Vi), it is critical for us and mCODE to explore the determinants of scalability to ensure sustainability of the model and wider adoption. (See the details about scaling up process in our research framework, section B.2.1.).

Our guiding research question is: How can the model’s adoption be scaled up for diverse public library community contexts? Our supporting research questions are:

  • What are the strategies that effectively address identified obstacles of library’s data engagement?
  • What role will the evolving community of practice play in the scaling up process and secondly?
  • How successful the toolkit will be in addressing barriers to model adoption?

For enhancing libraries' engagement with community knowledge and data, our specific aims of this project are:

  • To investigate strategies that effectively address identified obstacles,
  • To elevate our initiatives with improved scalability of the model, and to establish stronger links and meaningful connections between libraries and open data by adding community contexts.

See the figure 4 for our theoretical approach for scaling up.

Figure 4. Scaling up framework
